subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4
msgSnippet: ... Nothing is coming to mind at the present time.  Let me give this some more thought.  It may be a dead horse. BTW: I appreciate your openness to
messageBody:
Kent Beck wrote:

> Jason,
>
> I see what you mean. However, one of our goals in JUnit 4 was to
> remove the
> recursive composition of tests. It is difficult to explain and
> difficult to
> support properly in test runners. What I need is an example of JUnit
> 4-style
> dynamic test case creation.
>
Nothing is coming to mind at the present time. Let me give this some
more thought. It may be a dead horse.

BTW: I appreciate your openness to suggestions.

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
